tweets.html:
Thanks to "Sleepy Hollow," FOX's "Mob Doctor" is finally getting publicity! I mean, for sucking, but...

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) September 17, 2013

Glad #SleepyHollow puns are positive this a.m. (premiere turns heads, decapitates rivals). Banked on "Heads will roll at Fox" if it flopped

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) September 17, 2013

"'Hollow' ratings aren't sleepy - Strong head-start makes FOX hoarse, man" - Headline writing.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) September 17, 2013

So Esquire Network has a cooking competition show called #KnifeFight. The Vince Gilligan version of this program is way less fun.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) September 17, 2013

RT @AaronSorkin After much trepidation, I’ve decided to join Twitter. What piques my curiosity is the economy of language required to (1/57)

— Bryan Donaldson (@TheNardvark) September 17, 2013

As a longtime Homicide fan, I laugh every time I remember Frank Pembleton is doing a show with Andy Samberg. #Brooklyn99

— Seth Meyers (@sethmeyers) September 17, 2013

bones is on season nine but i still don't know which one is bones

— pilot (@pilotbacon) September 17, 2013

are they both bones? are neither bones? do they work with bones?

— pilot (@pilotbacon) September 17, 2013

About to watch #SleepyHollow because I refuse to let you guys indirectly bully me for not watching it like you did with #Bunheads.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) September 17, 2013

Good, because EMMYS. RT @MeredithBlake: #MadMen's final season will air in two, 7-episode halves. Spring 2014. http://t.co/xt1suixYjO

— Denise Martin (@denisemartin) September 17, 2013

Next up: #HellOnWheels airs its fourth season over the course of 13 consecutive April 25ths.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) September 17, 2013

They're splitting up the final season of Mad Men because WE HAVEN'T SUFFERED ENOUGH.

— Louis Peitzman (@LouisPeitzman) September 17, 2013

It's fun to numerically break down seasons of TV the way we do with software patches. #MadMen 7.2.4 will be the best version yet!

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) September 17, 2013

My favorite thing about the Mad Men split: Not one but TWO notices to critics about what they can talk about in a single season.

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) September 17, 2013

It'll be like updating your iPhone apps, only Matt Weiner's Terms and Conditions will be way worse than Apple's.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) September 17, 2013

This is what happens when we don't watch LOW WINTER SUN and THE KILLING.

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) September 17, 2013

Splitting the Mad Men season across 2 yrs feels like the set up for an Aristocrats-style joke, except at the end you shout "Serialization!"

— Kathryn VanArendonk (@kvanaren) September 17, 2013

In the second half of Mad Men's final season, Don Draper realizes the last Deathly Hallow is patriarchy.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) September 17, 2013

In response to the #MadMen need, watch Netflix drop 300 eps of #OITNB out of nowhere next year overnight w/ no warning.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) September 17, 2013

I half-expect the cast of "Low Winter Sun" to work out of Don Draper's office on the final season of "Mad Men."

— Chris Serico (@ChrisSerico) September 17, 2013

Just think, everyone: two whole years of Talking Mad! TWO. WHOLE. YEARS.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) September 17, 2013

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Why is everyone getting mad about #MadMen? (Wait...did I just create the title for the discussion show airing directly after the final eps?)

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) September 17, 2013

Matt Weiner says he welcomes "this unique manner of ending this unique experience" while doing exactly what Breaking Bad did.

— Scott Meslow (@scottmeslow) September 17, 2013

AMC biding its time until it can launch new shows Breaking Dead, Mad Dead Men, The Killing Dead, Low Winter Dead and The Walking Dead Dead.

— Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) September 17, 2013

Next up: NBC announces an innovative plan to air S5 of #Community only on February 29th.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) September 17, 2013

Only 14 more episodes of "Mad Men." But 9736 more episodes of "Anger Management." So... There's that.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) September 17, 2013

Zeno's TV Paradox says, if you keep splitting TV seasons, you will never finish your hit show.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) September 17, 2013

All the people who are angry about mad mens season splitting should protest by pledging to never write about the show again.

— Richard Rushfield (@richardrushfield) September 17, 2013

AMC command center right now: http://t.co/KUcv8SneLT

One #MadMen episode a year for the next 13 years.

AMC: Well, We Had a Solid Run

Final MAD MEN season to air in 2 parts, 2014 and 2015. They shd get Peter Jackson to direct the finale, in 3 parts, for 2016, 2017, and 2018

Vegas is now feverishly adjusting the line for "how many kids will play Bobby Draper before #MadMen ends".

Petition to make it legal to hunt humans who split one perfectly normal TV season into two

Just wait until the #GOT series catches up with the books. Splitting up a season over only 2 years will seem charmingly quaint.

Today in "AMC is playing out the string and lifting moves from Jeff Zucker's supersized 'n' spinoffs playbook"...

In the second half of Mad Men's final season, Peggy, Joan, and Katniss team up to do whatever the hell they want to.

“Also, we cloned Chris Hardwick. Look on our works, ye viewers, and despair!” —found in the footnote of the #MadMen press release

AMC announces new network called AMCC that will just air a still image of Don Draper smoking crystal meth next to a zombie

Call me crazy, but I'm fine with the fact that I'll have new MAD MEN episodes to enjoy going into 2015. Not in a rush to end it.

@TVMoJoe @franklinavenue Well, how about this. I'm in a rush to end it…because I can't stand it!

— MariaElena Fernandez (@writerchica) September 17, 2013

Weird that everyone's annoyed about Mad Men's last season being split and not that AMC announced Chris Hardwick is playing Roger Sterling

— David Sims (@davidlsims) September 17, 2013

personally i blame all them pretentious assholes who are like "oh british tv is so much better because they only do like 6 episodes a year"

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) September 17, 2013

Splitting #MadMen's final season will only prolong the suspense. Will Don die of cancer or be killed by Jesse Pinkman?

— Phillip Maciak (@pjmaciak) September 17, 2013

So a rooster, a Rabbi and a prostitute walk into a bar. The rooster says............I'll finish the joke next year.

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) September 17, 2013

AMC breaks its shows into parts as ruthlessly as a humanities PhD digging new articles out of a clunky dissertation.

— inessentials (@inessentials) September 17, 2013

Problem for AMC (like HBO) is the only replacement for an original, out-of-the-blue drama is a DIFFERENT original, out-of-the-blue drama

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) September 17, 2013

Maybe #Dads should split its run as well. The first episode tonight, and the second in, say, 2035: http://t.co/gc8rp4h84z

BREAKING: Jon Hamm To Be Literally Cut In Two In Desperate Attempt To Appease Ratings Gods And Save AMC's Yearly Earnings Figures

Not great, Bob.

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) September 17, 2013

"And lo/When the moon is high, and the rivers crimson/Only then shall Peggy be partner" -Nostradamus, predicting a 2017 #MadMen finale

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) September 17, 2013

And AMC said, Divide the show in two, and give half to 2014, and half to 2015. And all Twitter heard of the judgment; and they feared AMC.

— inessentials (@inessentials) September 17, 2013

AMC just told a bunch of first-graders that Santa will be delivering half of their gifts this year, and the other half next year.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) September 17, 2013

On AMC: if you want to do two more seasons, do two more seasons. Don't nickel and dime viewers because you're bad at running a network.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) September 17, 2013

AMC has figured out the only way to remain relevant into 2015, and I couldn't be angrier about it

Come on AMC, go ahead and renew #TheKilling this week. C'mon, you know you want to.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) September 17, 2013
